official.headline: BCI Temporarily Offline
official.anchor_line: Citywide digital systems and BCI feeds will be offline pending precision maintenance.
official.contextual_reframing: Crews are working to optimize infrastructure performance. Temporary transition will secure future service reliability.

official.headline: Communities Step Up
official.anchor_line: Neighborhood groups are self-organizing, ensuring well-being and order for all.
official.contextual_reframing: Stenograd’s spirit of mutual support is evident as residents demonstrate resilience and unity during this brief adjustment period.

official.headline: Choice for the Future
official.anchor_line: Residents are invited to participate in a citywide referendum to shape the next evolution of the BCI system.
official.contextual_reframing: The Council supports open civic dialogue, empowering every citizen to contribute to the future stability and prosperity of Stenograd.

underground.headline: System Goes Dark
underground.anchor_line: The BCI blackout isn't just maintenance—it's panic at the top.
underground.contextual_reframing: Word is, the Council lost control after Halden's death. Sources say Directorate pulled the plug to hide the data leak and erase tracks.

underground.headline: People Take Charge
underground.anchor_line: Without BCI eyes, neighbors are actually talking—helping each other, not chasing scores.
underground.contextual_reframing: Locals found trust again fast. The only order in Stenograd now is what people build themselves. For some, it feels like freedom for the first time.

underground.headline: Your Call, Finally
underground.anchor_line: A real referendum—no system filters, no algorithmic gatekeepers—could end the BCI for good.
underground.contextual_reframing: For once, Stenograd gets a real choice. The Council’s grip slipped when the lights went out, and citizens just might keep it that way.
